Posted By: blindthrall (1/25/2013 2:15:19 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Perfectly suited for my [ethereal armor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=ethereal armor) aggro deck, where removal was one of the only ways I'd lose. Now try exiling my scary 10/11 [vampire nighthawk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=vampire nighthawk) or even a beefed up [shadow alley denizen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=shadow alley denizen), but I get to keep all my auras instead! Ha!   
  
Losing life for creature removal is fine by me, at least its equal to its toughness and not the cmc. That last ability works wonders with the shadow alley denizen and especially [thrull parasite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=thrull parasite). Straight to the battlefield is the phrase i like to see :D  
  
Throw in some [blind obedience](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=blind obedience), [gift of orzhova](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=gift of orzhova) and [exquisite blood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=exquisite blood) (plus the [vizkopa guildmage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=vizkopa guildmage)) and you've got a hurtful, beautiful enchantment deck thats faster than some aggro decks.  
  
thanks orzhov, for breaking the mold constantly, but especially with this charm. 5/5 for art and utility!!
posts.html:
Perfectly suited for my ethereal armor aggro deck, where removal was one of the only ways I'd lose. Now try exiling my scary 10/11 vampire nighthawk or even a beefed up shadow alley denizen, but I get to keep all my auras instead! Ha!

Losing life for creature removal is fine by me, at least its equal to its toughness and not the cmc. That last ability works wonders with the shadow alley denizen and especially thrull parasite. Straight to the battlefield is the phrase i like to see :D

Throw in some blind obedience, gift of orzhova and exquisite blood (plus the vizkopa guildmage) and you've got a hurtful, beautiful enchantment deck thats faster than some aggro decks.

thanks orzhov, for breaking the mold constantly, but especially with this charm. 5/5 for art and utility!!

Posted By: .Blaze. (1/24/2013 6:03:34 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: The first mode of this card is worded perfectly to combo with [Soul Ransom](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Soul Ransom). Because the ability of Soul Ransom is Discard two cards: blah blah blah, when they discard the two cards the ability has to resolve for Soul Ransom to be sacrificed. Orzhov Charm in response, now the guy goes to their hand instead of them getting him back on the battlefield, they are down two cards, and you just got Soul Ransom back to recast as soon as they put a guy out.
posts.html:

Posted By: Amnesigenic (1/31/2013 12:25:12 AM)

posts.post_content:
This card suits orzhov perfectly in my opinion.  
  
1st ability is ok. Some opponents may wait for u to swing with [Obzedat, Ghost Council](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Obzedat, Ghost Council) and then instant kill it. U just bounce it and start machine going again the same or next turn. [Restoration Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Restoration Angel) is another good target if u build deck using it.  
  
2nd is with no doubt the best. If u manage to get some extra life, its price wont be that bad. And as i see it, it just rapes [spark trooper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=spark trooper)+[silverblade paladin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=silverblade paladin) combo (and i think this combo will see a lot of play). 12+12 hp life swing for 4 mana? Make it 1 hp for 2 mana. Orzhov LOVE that kind of deal;) Also use this before gruuls creature starts attacking, as their creatures may grow with bloodrush  
  
3rd ability is also nice. If you build Orzhov deck consider dead [Cathedral Sanctifier](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cathedral Sanctifier) or [Doomed Traveler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doomed Traveler) as main targets. 3rd color splash can make [Deathrite Sha](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deathrite Sha)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
I like the "save my creature AND Auras" effect, but having to recast them all could be a hassle. Or you could use it as a chance to put the Auras on something else.   
  
The last effect is really limited, but it's nice for the really useful 1-drops that tend to die quick. Like Vexing Devil, Deathrite Shaman, Doomed Traveller, Tormented Soul... Do I need to go on?   
  
And the second effect... a cheap kill spell that isn't a rare. Don't care that I lose life when it kills something, it kills things and I don't have to trade or spend several dollars on a single removal card for my deck.
posts.html:
I like the "save my creature AND Auras" effect, but having to recast them all could be a hassle. Or you could use it as a chance to put the Auras on something else.

The last effect is really limited, but it's nice for the really useful 1-drops that tend to die quick. Like Vexing Devil, Deathrite Shaman, Doomed Traveller, Tormented Soul... Do I need to go on?

And the second effect... a cheap kill spell that isn't a rare. Don't care that I lose life when it kills something, it kills things and I don't have to trade or spend several dollars on a single removal card for my deck.

Posted By: Mode (1/26/2013 9:03:19 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I don't think this card is that powerful.  
  
Someone said they like the effect of returning a creature to your hand to reuse ETB effects, but why not just use [Cloudshift](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cloudshift) for that? Sure, Cloudshift is not as flexible, but it's 1 mana less to cast, and on top of that, you don't have to recast a 4-mana spell.  
  
Destroying a creature is a good effect, and but the downside is pretty harsh. It may not seem so bad some of the time, but if mono red/boros is going to be as popular as I think it will be, this is the removal spell you will absolutely not want to have in your hand. Even losing 2 or 3 life could be 50% of your remaining life in some cases.  
  
Returning cards from your graveyard to play is not too bad, but the 1 mana casting cost is very restrictive. This effect is better the more blocks you have access to I guess, but in standard, there just aren't that many 1-drops that are relevant later on in the game besides [Deathrite Shaman](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deathrite Shaman).  
  
Overall, the c... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

Destroying a creature is a good effect, and but the downside is pretty harsh. It may not seem so bad some of the time, but if mono red/boros is going to be as popular as I think it will be, this is the removal spell you will absolutely not want to have in your hand. Even losing 2 or 3 life could be 50% of your remaining life in some cases.

Returning cards from your graveyard to play is not too bad, but the 1 mana casting cost is very restrictive. This effect is better the more blocks you have access to I guess, but in standard, there just aren't that many 1-drops that are relevant later on in the game besides Deathrite Shaman.
